content.body: I strongly feel that conditionals improve readability in complex patterns, and can improve readability when you have to context switch between RegExp syntax and JS syntax. I'm also not forging net new syntax here, but asking the committee to consider adopting existing syntax that is a well trodden path across multiple heavily used implementations.

Yes, I've used it often enough in .NET. I'll admit, it is a niche feature compared to what we already support, but many of the cases where its used its either:

- Much easier to read than alternatives.

I think I only use call when it's bound, to turn a function of n parameters in to a function of n+1, where the first is the this-value: `const blink = Function.prototype.call.bind(String.prototype.blink); blink('DHTML')`
content.formatted_body: I think I only use call when it's bound, to turn a function of n parameters in to a function of n+1, where the first is the this-value: const blink = Function.prototype.call.bind(String.prototype.blink); blink('DHTML')
